title: WATCH LIVE | Limpopo IPID head to continue testimony at Zondo commission
text:
WATCH LIVE | Limpopo IPID head to continue testimony at Zondo commission

27 September, 09:30 AM

Innocent Khuba, the Limpopo head of the Independent Police Investigative Directorate (IPID), is expected to continue his testimony at the state capture commission of inquiry on Friday.

Khuba was the lead investigator in the so-called Zimbabwe rendition matter and was, according to former IPID head Robert McBride, allegedly asked to "falsely implicate" him and IPID's head of investigations, Matthew Sesoko.

McBride testified before the commission in April.

On Thursday Khuba told the commission that he allegedly learned through former Hawks boss General Berning Ntlemeza that General Anwa Dramat - the Directorate for Priority Crime Investigating head at the time - would be suspended from his post weeks before it was splashed all over the media.

The commission will also hear testimony of former crime intelligence member, Colonel Dhanajaya Gangulu Naidoo. Naidoo is currently in witness protection and his testimony will be heard in-camera at a separate location.
